messages.title: Exclusive Interview Inside: John Hayward
messages.content: John Hayward brings an understanding of how the academic, scientific and voluntary sectors all contribute to the rich mosaic of Cambridge.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Establish Britain as the strongest country in Europe
keyPolicies.policyDescription: In economy, national security, and international influence.
Rewards people who work hard and creates secure and well-paid jobs.
Helping families to get on in life, building more affordable housing and giving everyone dignity and security in old age.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Build a more secure and united nation
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Taking action against the extremists who use violence to divide our society and standing up to separatists who want to break up our country.

mentions.candidate: John brings an understanding of how the academic, scientific and voluntary sectors all contribute to the rich mosaic of Cambridge.

issues.brexitEurope: We need a General Election now to secure the strong and stable leadership the country needs to see us through Brexit and beyond.
issues.economy: Build a stronger economy that rewards people who work hard and creates secure and well-paid jobs.
issues.government: Strong and stable leadership in the national interest with Theresa May and the Conservatives - or weak and unstable coalition government led by Jeremy Corbyn.

community.content: Making Cambridge even greater: John Hayward has met the region’s newly-elected Mayor, James Palmer. They discussed both Cambridge’s housing needs and the traffic gridlock that currently plagues our streets.

leaflet.personalStatement: We need a General Election now to secure the strong and stable leadership the country needs to see us through Brexit and beyond.

politicalExperience.achievements: Helps shape government policy on international development.

contactInformation.address: Conservatives, BFI Studios, 20 Easter Studway, Cambridge, CB1 9PJ

endorsements.endorsement: John brings understanding of how the academic, scientific and voluntary sectors all contribute to the rich mosaic of Cambridge.

quotes.text: John brings an understanding of how the academic, scientific and voluntary sectors all contribute to the rich mosaic of Cambridge.
quotes.source: East of England MEP Vicky Ford

images.caption: John Hayward & MEP Vicky Ford shared their post-Brexit concerns in Brussels.
John Hayward and Mayor James Palmer discussed Metro plans.

examples: Strong and stable leadership in the national interest with Theresa May and the Conservatives - or weak and unstable coalition government led by Jeremy Corbyn.
John brings an understanding of how the academic, scientific and voluntary sectors all contribute to the rich mosaic of Cambridge.
We need a General Election now to secure the strong and stable leadership the country needs to see us through Brexit and beyond.

Making Cambridge even greater: John Hayward has met the region’s newly-elected Mayor, James Palmer. They discussed both Cambridge’s housing needs and the traffic gridlock that currently plagues our streets.
Strong and stable leadership in the national interest with Theresa May and the Conservatives - or weak and unstable coalition government led by Jeremy Corbyn.

personalStories.story: John’s recent work has been as Manager at the national Forum that enables people who actually live in the regions to shape government policy.

examples: John brings understanding of how the academic, scientific and voluntary sectors all contribute to the rich mosaic of Cambridge - East of England MEP Vicky Ford.
Strong and stable leadership in the national interest with Theresa May and the Conservatives - or weak and unstable coalition government led by Jeremy Corbyn.
